citation.article-title: Holophaga foetida gen. nov., sp. nov., a new, homoacetogenic bacterium degrading methoxylated aromatic compounds

p.s: Description of Holophaga foetida sp. nov.
Holophaga foetida (foetidus L. adj. smelling, stinking; foe.ti'da, stinking, referring to production of ill-smelling methanethiol and dimethylsulfide)

Growth is supported by 3,4,5-trimethoxybenzoate, syringate, 5-hydroxyvanillate, phloroglucinolmonomethylether, sinapate, ferulate, caffeate, gallate, 2,4,6-trihydroxybenzoate, pyrogallol, phloroglucinol, and pyruvate.

The following substrates were not utilized: hydrogen, formate, lactate, malate, fumarate, succinate, tartrate, glycolate, methoxyacetate, methoxyethanol, cyclopentanecarboxylate, cyclohexanecarboxylate, methanol, ethanol, 1-propanol, 1-butanol, glycerol, 1,2-ethanediol, fructose, benzoate, 3-phenylpropionate, 4-hydroxybenzoate, 4-hydroxyphenylpropionate, 2,4-dihydroxybenzoate, 3,4-dihydroxybenzoate, 3,5-dihydroxybenzoate, 2-methoxybenzoate, 3-methoxybenzoate, 4-methoxybenzoate, 4-methoxyphenylacetate, 4-methoxyphenylpropionate, 4-methoxycinnamate, vanillate, hydrocaffeate, anisole, p-anisaldehyde, phenol, catechol, resorcinol, betaine, trimethylamine.
Nonmotile rod-shaped bacteria with a size of 1-3 gm by 0.5-0.7 μm in syringate medium.
Colonies in agar medium are lens-shaped with entire margins, translucent and beige.
Optimal growth occurs at 28-32~ with a Tmin at 10°C and a Tmax at 35°C The pH range for growth is 5.5-8.0 with an optimum at 6.8-7.5.
The DNA base composition of the type strain is 62.5 mol%.
The type strain is strain TMBS4 (DSM 6591), which was isolated from a dilution series in liquid media inoculated with black anoxic freshwater mud from a ditch near Konstanz (Germany).
